issue.title: world frame does not go with tf across network

content.raw:
This may be a problem of the `/tf_static` messages not being latched properly, so that new subscribers (such as the ones on another machine) don't receive info about the `world` frame (which is a static transform). The ihmc controller is already publishing a pose estimate of the robot relative to the world, which is the hard part of odometry. The world frame location could usually be a static transform of all zeros, so I don't think it's hard to guess what that frame should be if it isn't provided. I think this is simply a bug in a ROS library.

cc: @tfoote
